page.title: 11WILD ANIMALS IN CHILMARK
page.content: {Roe Deer}are commonly seen around the villages. They come at first light and at dusk to graze in grass and cornfields.{Hares}are occasionally seen but are becoming rare due to monoculture of grass for hay and silage They like rough pastures and stay in a grass nest or form most of the day.{Foxes}prowl round at night hunting for mice and birds and will kill chickens unless these are sec_ urely housed.{Hedgehogs}live in our gardens and eat slugs and snails. Moles dig tunnels in the fields and throw up earth mounds as they hunt for worms.{Rats}are a pest as they eat stored corn and vegetables. Sometimes they have to be poisoned. We also have house and garden{mice, badgers}in the woods,{stoats}and{weasels, grey {squirrels}and a few{rabbits. D.L.FORBES
